divs: sighting detailsi never really thought about informing anyone of this, but when i found out this site was available - and you are a serious credible service, i decided to let you know what i saw\heard. also - with as many things that are occurring with evidence in stephenville, i thought there may be other reports during the same timeframe. in 1985-88, i lived north of stephenville about 4 miles along highway 281, towards morgan mill. it was a dirt\gravel road that was known since some guy at the corner had his own uphostlery place - don't upholstery i think. the timeframe is very vague - because it was a long time ago. the facts of the timeframe are winter - because it was pretty cold, and 85-86 more than likely - because my parents were in new mexico and they wouldn't leave me home alone if i was younger. more than likely - 1986. i was inside my house, either watching tv or messing around with some board game when i heard a low vibration sound - like a very low bass humming. as it got louder, i went outside as it was obvious it was not in my house. the night was super dark - no cloudcover and no moon (new moon, i guess). there were stars everywhere. i heard the sound coming from the north and looked up in the sky but saw nothing. the noise was getting closer - not necessarily louder - and i still was looking for anything. no lights - nothing. then what was weird, i realized whatever was making that sound had no lights. whatever was making the noise, was in a "black out" or "lights out" mode. the only way i could tell this was that as the noise went over me, all the stars started to disappear - as if something was blocking the view. the only way to describe the object is a very long rectangular shape. if i had to give measurement, i'd say 50 yards wide (at most?) but at least 200 yards in length. it's difficult to say how high it was. if i had to guess, i would say somewhere between 50-100 yards...but that is a very limited guess. it went south over our area (this is just west of hwy 281) and as far as i could tell, never increased speed (i'd say maybe 25 mph) and never turned on any lights. i lost sight of it when i couldn't tell if stars further away were being blocked from view. i thought maybe it could have been a blimp - but weeks later i thought - what the hell would a blimp be doing in stephenville, at night, with no lights on? i thought about reporting it, but i never went further with that thought. even though i have always been fascinated by the unknown, i can honestly say that high school, girls and friends had a higher priority in my life.
Summary: Slow moving Object in dark night sky near Stephenville
trends: There have been 74 other sightings in Stephenville
There were no other sightings in Stephenville on or around December 10th 1986
